themes: lack of clear and comprehensive city leadership
unorganized and unprofessional cultural funding process
city staff inadequacy and lack of training
disregard for artist feedback in system changes
urgency of cultural funding distribution in 2025
poor communication and transparency about funding timelines
erosion of trust in city leadership
key_phrases: lack of clear and comprehensive leadership from city staff
Cultural Funding process to be unorganized, unprofessional, and at times deeply humiliating
city staff paid to advocate for local artists to be unsuitable or not trained
review the feedback we have already given (over many years)
Don't ask us to show up and share our feedback if you are not going to listen and take action
deeply discouraged and have very little faith in city leadership
Cultural Funding MUST be distributed this year in 2025
plans to wait and only offer funding for projects that will begin in 2026
Why were we not told this in 2024?!
one more example of failed leadership
barriers_identified: lack of clear and comprehensive leadership from city staff
humiliating experiences for local artist leaders
lack of communication about funding delays
solutions_proposed: review the feedback we have already given
listen and take action based on what you hear
distribute Cultural Funding in 2025 as previously expected
